author: nishant0
content: In the proposal using simply the first 8 bytes is insecure as finding a collision is pretty trivial. The total hashrate of the bitcoin network is 600 exahashes / second. So you can technically find 32 collisions for any given root in a second. Also you would have 2 epochs to find and generate a bogus root which is plenty of time for many collisions. Increasing it to 16 bytes would mitigate it for now

author: nishant0
content: the message is what we propagate not the message id to our mesh peers

author: nishant0
content: Message id is only relevant when we emit random gossip to all our peers every heartbeat

author: nishant0
content:
I think gossiping attestation data separately is tricky and introduces wierd race conditions. Its already been discussed above, but how we would queue it would be pretty different from our pending queues. Also this would definitely interfere with aggregation, we do not have big window to produce aggregates so you could see more inefficient aggregates being produced. 

Decoupling attestation data from an attestation would necessitate us signing it otherwise anyone in the network can produce such a message and put bogus data in

author: funnygiulio
content: Ah okay, but to be clear, this does not change underlying gurantees as that can happen in any topic regardless

author: funnygiulio
content: It does add complexity, yes, but 4 secs is a probably relatively big window for the network. Why do you think it will potentially make aggregates less efficient if underlying bandwidth is reduced? It should be the opposite, the fact they are on separate topics, means that some attestations will be delayed slightly but definetely not seeing that exceeding 4 secs overall

author: funnygiulio
content: Most of them wont be delayed, quite the opposite. It is just the complexity of needing to keep a queue in memory to be a road blocker. Also note, that as I said before, i would agree if you were talking about new nodes, but i think they wont matter much

author: funnygiulio
content: If the delay is one second then fine, It is a stupid idea but 100-300 msec? That is not very significant especially as you have a 2x optimization down the line
